Authors:
William Eberhard, Jessica Pacheco, Farah Carrasco, Yuliana
Christopher, Daniel Ramos, Hector Raul Urbina, Meredith Blackwell
Title:
Zombie bugs? The fungus Purpureocillium sp. may manipulate
the behavior of its host bug Edessa rufomarginata
Keywords:
parasitic manipulation, pentatomid bug, Costa Rica,
insect
Abstract:
The fungus Purpureocillium sp. apparently induces its
host, the pentatomid bug Edessa rufomarginata, to move onto the stems
from the leaves of its host plant, and to grasp the stems firmly in ways
seldom employed by living bugs. These alterations in host behavior
probably improve the chances that the subsequently produced fungal
spores will be dispersed aerially.
